comments.body: This is intentional: I removed produce / consume and yahoo since they do not have streams app and hence no jmx metrics to collect, I'm adding some more logic to re-enable them in https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/4744
Just for my own education: average and max of what?

This is to calculate the avg and max of all the collected metrics. In this PR I'm collecting poll / process / commit rate and latency, and compute the avg / max of all of them

In the follow-up PR (https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/4744) I'm collecting consumer metrics for comparison.

Sorry I have do do this series in not-so-independent PRs, as I do not want to add a too large one, but separating them into steps is also a bit tricky.

I have also updated the description of this PR. Hope that helps understanding this change better.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +108,112 @@
            final["jmx-avg" + str(num)] = self.driver[num].average_jmx_value
            final["jmx-max" + str(num)] = self.driver[num].maximum_jmx_value

        return final
